meanings.def: angry, and behaving in a threatening way; ready to attack
examples: Seals have been known to exhibit aggressive behaviour towards swimmers.
He became increasingly aggressive as the evening wore on.
He gets aggressive when he's drunk.
aggressive towards somebody She warned that her dog was aggressive towards strangers.
Her mood became openly aggressive when his name was mentioned.
Watching violence on TV makes some children more aggressive.
As a teenager George was aggressive and moody.
It is important at all times to discourage aggressive behaviour in young children.

meanings.def: determined and acting with force in order to succeed
examples: aggressive in something We need to get more aggressive in our approach.
aggressive in doing something The firm is extremely aggressive in seeking new markets.
A good salesperson has to be aggressive in today's competitive market.
I was put off by his aggressive sales pitch.
He thrilled the crowd with his aggressive driving style on the track.
the company's highly aggressive marketing techniques

meanings.def: developing quickly and difficult to treat
examples: Doctors diagnosed her with a rare and aggressive cancer, which was feared to be incurable.

meanings.def: using all possible treatment options in order to extend somebody’s life
examples: Nicholas was diagnosed with the rare disease in November and has undergone aggressive treatments since then.
